title: Syllabus mentioned in ERP
text: Human body â musculo-skeletal system; Principles of continuum mechanics, Rheology, visco-elasticity. Properties and mechanics of soft and hard tissues (bones, cartilage, tendon, ligaments and muscles). Idealization of musculoskeletal system; classification of joints and relation to motion; synarthrodial, amphiarthrodial and diarthrodial.Kinematics and kinetics of rigid bodies; Euler s equation; Lagrange s equation; spring-mass-dashpot system; Inverse dynamics, Sports mechanics; Computer simulation of different athletic activities; Design of prosthetics and other accessories; biomechanical effects of implants on the musculoskeletal system. Introduction to mechanics of other important organs â lungs, heart and kidney. Simulation Softwares and virtual reality in medical science for training and educational purposes.
